The backend app has no module yet that should be displayed in the admin dashboard

Some helpful functions that can be reused. Module created for a DRY flow in the project.

backend.aider.get_client_ip(request)¶

Takes input a request and returns the IP from the quest

A module for context processors in the project

backend.context_processors.live(request)¶

Return True if LIVE or False otherwise

Models of the backend app. They should save data persistently that represents important information about the project

Another utility module with useful functions

Module containing server listeners, error handling views, and SMTP clients

class hub.models.Resursa(*args, **kwargs)¶

Resursa model. No longer used in the project It was deactivated on client’s wish. It’s similar to a blog structure but contains in addition on video url and a different image field.

Tests module

class hub.tests.TestHub(methodName='runTest')¶
Testing manager for the hub app.

Subclass of TestCase

classmethod setUp()¶

Static method for general setup

test_model_creation()¶
This methos covers the instantiation of the model classes.

!!! Please keep in mind that the process uses a different database for testing, so any saved instance won’t be found in the real database. The instance is destroyed when the test returns.

test_requests()¶
Simulate requests to the endpoints/views

Consider status code 200 as passed test.

test_resolve_views()¶
Validates the urls and their views

(Check if the urls match the views)

test_reverse_urls()¶
Validates the urls and their names

(Check if the urls match the names)

class blog.models.Tag(*args, **kwargs)¶

Tag. A class that is assigned to one ore more blog posts to classifiy it. A blog post can have more tags. A tag is defined by one single slug.

get_queryset()¶

Return the list of items for this view.

The return value must be an iterable and may be an instance of QuerySet in which case QuerySet specific behavior will be enabled.

contact/forms Contains one contact form. Send the massage to the Selfpower team by email. See SMTP configuration for the implementation

class contact.forms.contactForm(*args, **kwargs)¶

Contact form. Uses SMTP and the Google accounts

clean()¶

Verify fields after POST sending. Check for error and problems.

Most of this method consists in the Google reCaptcha verification the anti-bot point. For details see Google docs.

test_postContactFormInvRecaptcha()¶

Test for when g-recaptcha-response field is in POST request but is invalid. Issue #122

test_postContactFormNoRecaptcha()¶

Test for Internal Server Error when g-recaptcha-response is missing from the POST request. Issue #122

donations.views.pdf_view(request)¶

Returns a pdf, the form with the redirecting of 2% out of salary

Use this for debugging, to find out what is your MEDIA_ROOT path:

print(settings.MEDIA_ROOT) #use this for debugging

/login app.

test_create_user()¶
Creates an user inside the parallel DB.

It gets autodestroyed after the tests -iterate an user creation -check if the user matches with its own membership -check if the user matches with its own user profile

test_resolve_views()¶
Validates the urls and their views

Match the urls with their specific views

test_reverse_urls()¶

Validates the urls and their names (Matching urls and names)

Tokens used for password reset

class login.tokens.TokenGenerator¶

Tokens generator for password resetting

Authentication system and users manager.

a) signup -signup form -activation link

b)login -classical login, using username and password -rapid login using magic link send by email

c)profile -user data update throug profile page -membership (currently inactive feature) -handles paid and free user-memberships

User-website interface. Contains the following webpages:

-manual login form -magic link login trigger -sign up gate -profile info page

login.views.activate(request, uidb64, token, backend='django.contrib.auth.backends.ModelBackend')¶

Defines the account activation process

login.views.profile(request)¶
Profile page where the user information is displayed

-the user can updates his/her user info

login.views.signup(request)¶

Webpage for signup It contains a form that precedes the email verification
